direction.raw_text: We start on a man's elegant slipper.  He is seated in a splendid chair.  Moving up the stocking leg, we pass the garter of Castile, coming to rest on a pair of delicate hands.  His fore finger impatiently plays with a large topaz ring.  Over this, we hear distant footsteps, echoing on marble floors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A Castilian face:  aquilaine profile, olive complexion, dark eyebrows and meticulously sculpted beard.  This is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A door slams somewhere, the footsteps getting closer.  We can now here a subdued conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands up as: The door opens at the far end of the large gilded room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: magnificent in somber taffeta, enters.  QUEEN ISABEL OF SPAIN moves towards him. He bows slightly as she sits at the end of the large table.  She is followed by a PRIEST, BROTHER BUYL, and three dignitaries of Church and State. All sit beside her.  TREASURER SANCHEZ takes a document and starts to read aloud. On screen the words:  GRANADA - SPAIN - 1500 SANCHEZ Your Majesty would wish to know the true facts concerning the island of Hispanola, our first settlement in the New World, and the activities there of your servant, Christopher Columbus, Admiral of the Ocean Sea, Governor of that Island.  You will remember with what hopes and promises he beguiled us -- the truth is that he now presides over a state of chaos, degradation and madness beyond imagining.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: punctuates each word carefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The PRIEST nods.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: From the beginning, Columbus proved himself incapable of managing the affairs of the island.  He appointed his brothers to important positions, at once injuring the pride and dignity of the nobles who had gone with him.  He promised to build a city, the City of Isabel, named after Your Majesty.  What he actually built was nothing but a collection of huts, and that in the wrong place, for all of it was easily swept away by rain and mud. Is that not so, Brother Buyl?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Your Honor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He promised gold.  Not finding the easy quantities he promised, Columbus commanded each Indian to pay an annual tribute.  Most being unable to, they were barbarously punished, against the express wish of Your Christian Majesties...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: lowers her eyes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Since provocation and injustice never ceases, many of the Indians have fled to the forests, or have begun to slay the Christians.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks over at BROTHER BUYL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Could it be so?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Your Majesty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But there is worse.  From the beginning, he forced the nobles to undergo physical labor, treating them equally with the Indians, all of them reduced to slavery.  When the nobleman Adrian de Moxica protested against such treatment... (he pauses) ... he was executed. (pause) Is that not true also, Brother Buyl?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Your Honor.  It is all true. All of it.  I saw it with my own eyes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He has lost control.  His great arrogance has led him into depravity.  He encourages our soldiers to marry the native women. He promised a paradise, but he has made a hell full of all its horrors.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that the man I knew, Treasurer Sanchez?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Your Majesty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ON the FACE:  COLUMBUS is stretched on a bed, sweating heavily in fever, clearly delirious.  Insects crawl over his face, he makes no effort to swat them away. There is a dripping sound of water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rain is falling into the room over documents spread on a table.  COLUMBUS stands up and moves to the table.  Some of the walls have been blackened with smoke and flames.  A lizard scuttles into the shadows.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Of all the words my Father wrote and there were many, I remember these the most.  "Nothing that results from human progress is achieved with unanimous consent..."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) "And those who are enlightened before the others are condemned to purse that light in spite of others..."
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: stares down at the documents, moving them away from the rain drips.  He stares out by the window, and we see: A devastated landscape.  Flooded roads, half-destroyed huts, broken trees... A dog picks its way through the mud.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) There was a time when the New World didn't exist...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A vast stretch of ocean.  It fills the screen.  Unbroken, infinite, luminous, mysterious -- it stretches away, meeting and blending with the sky in pale ribbons of pearl and misty light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pulling back, we discover:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) ... The sun set in the west on an ocean where no man had dared to venture.  And beyond that, infinity...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and a strongly built man in his middle thirties, are riding a mule.  The MAN'S weather-beaten face frames unusually bright eyes. On the screen these words:  ANDALUSIA, 1491 COLUMBUS AND HIS SON are following a windthrashed path at the top of the hill.  COLUMBUS hums a song, and FERNANDO looks up at him in adoration.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Once I asked my Father where he wanted to go.  And he replied:  "I want to travel all over the seas.  I want to get behind the weather..."
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: laughs.  He then starts to hum along with his
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A rugged landscape, remote and steep, with lines of stone walls and thousands of sheep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rushes down a slope, barking like a dog, chasing the sheep who fan out in droves in front of him.  High- spirited and wild, FERNANDO laughs and tumbles over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rides his mule along the narrow track, watching his SON'S antics with amusement.  In the distance, the solitary figure of A MONK SHEPHERD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: calls out to his son:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Fernando!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: runs over.  COLUMBUS lifts him up onto the mule. As they move along the track we now see, perched on a distant hill, isolated and austere, the Monastery of La Rabida, their destination.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they dismount and walk into the quiet cloisters,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: suddenly spots a familiar FIGURE, standing under the ROMAN arches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He rushes over, full of joy, to kiss his BROTHER -- an adolescent dressed in the novice-robe, with a solemn, delicate face.  DIEGO'S response is constrained.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Diego!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Diego!  Aren't you going to kiss your brother?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: smiles a little, and kisses FERNANDO -- who is immediately distracted by a procession of hooded MONKS, hurrying to the refectory, as a bell begins to chime. The MONKS all turn to greet ANTONIO DE MARCHENA, a white- haired, elderly man -- and a monk cosmographer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gesture is broad and elegant as he opens his arms to greet COLUMBUS.  He pats FERNANDO'S head and turns to DIEGO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both CHILDREN leave under the arched roof.  COLUMBUS and
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Diego, take Fernando to the dining hall.  He must be hungry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: begin to walk across the cloister.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Diego is a bright boy -- a pleasure to teach -- but so serious... Brothers should be raised together, Colon.  Even brothers from different mothers...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Father, I am doing what I think is the best for him.  And he has the teacher I would have chosen for myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: laughs at the compliment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They have crossed the cloister.  MARCHENA pushes open a door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Just be careful you don't lose him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hundreds of books lined up on the shelves, displaying the miracle of printing, a recent German discovery.  Several
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: perched on high stools behind lecterns, are busily
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: some of these massive volumes, delicately painting around the letters in bright colors and gold leaf. Rays of light fall diagonally through high openings, projecting geometric patterns on the tiled floor.  As
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and COLUMBUS move forward their conversation is punctuated by light and shadow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost casually, he hands COLUMBUS a letter.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (fumbles in a pocket under his robe) I have something for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You will be heard at the University of Salamanca...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: stops dead in his tracks.  Almost frantically he tears open the letter, hardly able to believe his eyes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: God... That's in a week!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what it says.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How did you manage it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) With some difficulty.  I had to promise them you were not a total fool.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: pushes open a second door, hidden behind a wooden panel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is not a tidy man.  Books are piled up on the floor, the desk, on every shelf, along with maps, instruments of astronomy... the visible evidence of an inquiring mind. With practiced familiarity, as if they had done this a hundred times -- which indeed they have -- MARCHENA sits behind his desk, and COLUMBUS opposite him.  MARCHENA lights a candle and considers the mess.  Then methodically, he slowly sweeps it from in front of him with his sleeve, exposing a large map underneath. When he looks up again, there is a new severity in his expression.  He turns over an hourglass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leans forward, and points to the map spread out on the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His finger traces the journey, from west to east.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are CLOSE now on the map, as we watch his finger tracing a line between Europe and the Far East.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We notice that the outline of the European continent is familiar.  But we also notice that, in that great expanse of ocean, the whole American continent is missing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why do you wish to sail west?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To open a new route to Asia.  At the moment there are only two ways of reaching it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: By sea, sailing around the African Continent -- the journey takes a year...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or by land...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) ... But the Turks have closed this route to all Christians.  Trading with the Orient has become arduous, if not dangerous. (he pauses) There is a third way...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: By sailing West across the Ocean Sea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: touched by the mystery.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How can you be so certain?  The Ocean is said to be infinite.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ignorance!  I believe the Indies are no more than 750 leagues west of the Canary Islands.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How can you be so certain?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The calculations of Toscanelli Marin de Tyr, Esdras...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) Esdras is a Jew.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So was Christ!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: throws his quill in the air in frustration.  He glances at the hourglass:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Two minutes... and already you're a dead man.  Don't let passion overwhelm you, Colon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (mockingly) I'll try to remember that, Marchena...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Father Marchena!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ignoring this) Passion is something one cannot control!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (heatedly) You get so carried away when you are being contradicted!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been contradicted all my life... Eternity!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (amused) Only God knows the meaning of such words, my son.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and FERNANDO wait in the courtyard.  COLUMBUS appears and lifts FERNANDO onto the mule.  DIEGO turns to go.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Diego.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: walks over to him, squats down so their eyes meet.  He looks at his SON for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uncomfortable with the proposition, DIEGO cannot find an answer.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Would you like to come and stay with us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll do whatever makes you happy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am happy, Father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: reaches out -- and touches his shoulder. He climbs up behind FERNANDO, who waves back to his
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as they ride off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leads the mule, carrying the sleeping FERNANDO, through narrow streets.  There's a clamorous noise in the air.  Suddenly a large group of YOUNG MEN, shouting with excitement, run up the street and brush past them.  Then more people.  FERNANDO sits up straight.  The noise grows, rowdy, rumbling, sharp with excitement and violence. Huge CROWDS have thronged the massive old square outside the cathedral.  Holding the mule by its reins, COLUMBUS tries to push his way through... Suddenly, as a gap opens in the crowd, we see the cause of the excitement:  in the center of the square stand three pyres, already alit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are busy around the fires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before COLUMBUS can stop him, FERNANDO has slipped off the mule and into the crowd. COLUMBUS Fernando! But the BOY has been swallowed into the mass of people.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Look, Father!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: tries to follow him.  Flames leap into the night sky with a terrible crackling, lighting up the square with a lurid glow.  Prayers are being chanted somewhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has elbowed his way to the front of the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: brandishes a crucifix in front of the face of a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: bound to a post.  The heretic wears the "sambenito", a robe made of coarse fabric on which his sins have been crudely illustrated -- we see cabalistic signs, indicating that the man is Jewish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: eyes are mad with fear.  But he refuses to kiss the crucifix, as a sign of his repentance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is transfixed by the scene, but still doesn't realize what is happening.  He is too close to the platform to see what is in the flames of the other pyres.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He motions to his son, takes the BOY'S hand, and drags him away from the scene.  But FERNANDO looks back.  The distance now allows him to see inside the flames.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Fernando!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: face is distorted in a silent scream... The neck snaps like burning wood, and the head falls on one shoulder.  Then the whole body collapses into the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and FERNANDO lead the mule into the white-washed, stone-floored hallway of the modest house.  FERNANDO is mute, shocked by what he just witnessed.  COLUMBUS takes the mule into its stall, and as he does so, his mother,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: appears from the kitchen to greet them.  She is a beautiful woman in her twenties, a calm, strong, domestic personality.  COLUMBUS tousles the BOY'S hair.  FERNANDO glances at his MOTHER but looks subdued and doesn't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: joins BEATRIX in the kitchen, where a MAID is cooking.  He explains Fernando's subdued manner.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Executions.  In the square.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods.  He goes to the stone butt and pours water on his hands.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They've agreed to see me in a week.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: puts the candle on the table.  Her face lights up with a smile.  He walks to her, and kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They laugh and kiss.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I could be gone for years.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I haven't given you much of a life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (amused) Well... that's true.  I have a child by a man who won't marry me!  Who's always leaving...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are we going to argue?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd love to argue with you sometimes.  But you're never here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perhaps I was never meant to live with a woman...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (still kissing him) I find that hard to believe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They are eating around the table, and FERNANDO is unusually silent and thoughtful.  COLUMBUS pours a little wine into FERNANDO'S water, to distract him.  FERNANDO looks up at him, surprised.  COLUMBUS smiles, then looks over at BEATRIX.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He winks at FERNANDO.  BEATRIX smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Fernando, don't you think we are lucky to live with such a beautiful woman?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The room is dark.  As COLUMBUS approached the bed with a candle, it illuminates the naked body of BEATRIX.  BEATRIX looks up at him intently.  A drop of wax falls on her skin.  She flinches, murmurs... They make love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A medieval "campus".  Students-novices are playing "pelote", with basket-gloves and a hard ball.  They run with their robes tucked around their waist, revealing white legs.  Others are studying, reading, hurrying to their class. We find COLUMBUS watching the game from the steps above the court.  Others are waiting with him.  A MONK comes from a door, and looks around the group.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (hesitant) Christopher Columbus?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: An El Greco painting.  A tableau of twenty MEN sitting on dark, sculpted seats.  Candles throw a gloomy light on their faces.  Some are Churchmen, others are dressed in bourgeois outfits. Only one of them is richly dressed in the grand Spanish fashion -- he is SANCHEZ, Treasurer of the House of Aragon.  A MONK (Don AROJAZ) holds a stick with an ivory claw at the top.  Languidly, he scratches his back -- his off-hand manner only makes him more impressive than his peers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leans back, satisfied, and pauses for effect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A ripple of mirthless laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A murmur of protest spreads among the members of the Commission.  But Columbus is determined to press his theories.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Indignant and amused murmurs.  DIEGO DE DEZA raises his voice to quiet the assembly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The murmur increases.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You say Asia can be found by sailing west?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, your Eminence.  The voyage should not take more than six or seven weeks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Unfortunately, Don Colon, that is precisely where our opinions differ... (pause) Are you familiar with the work of Aristotle?  Erathostene?  Ptolemeus?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am, Your Eminence
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then you cannot ignore that according to their calculations, the circumference of the Earth is approximately... (he leans forward)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: leagues or more.  Which makes the ocean... uncrossable.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you may have found new evidence proving that these men of knowledge are totally mistaken!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your Excellencies are aware of the statements of Marin de Tyr?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then you are also aware that his theories contradict Ptolemeus... De Tyr believes the Ocean to be only
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: leagues...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Florentine Toscanelli and the French Cardinal Pierre d'Ailly both think that Marin de Tyr is accurate in his calculations.  And therefore, that the ocean can be crossed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gentlemen, let us suppose Marin de Tyr is right... (the laughter subsides) Are we here to examine this proposal or not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Columbus) In your opinion, how long would the voyage be?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Seven weeks.  Six, during the summer months.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Marin de Tyr is wrong -- and has been corrected many times over the centuries by the finest geographers. Your voyage, Don Colon, would take a year!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of simple bearing, that COLUMBUS identifies as being a seaman, interrupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Instantly, the protests stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pauses, and starts walking in front of the experts, as a lawyer before a grand jury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The experts listen.  CLOSE ON SANCHEZ'S FACE, impressed by the boldness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks and stops before TALAVERA, and catches the look of SANCHEZ, sitting just behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conscious of a friendlier voice, COLUMBUS sees the Treasurer SANCHEZ, an imposing man in his fifties.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How would the crew survive without being able to land for fresh water? Water is undrinkable after six weeks!  You'd never be able to turn back!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We wouldn't have to turn back!  We would find land at this point!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Senor Colon, an experienced captain such as yourself will understand our concern with the crew.  I am not willing to have on my conscience the loss of men who would have relied upon our judgment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Excellency, you are right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am a seaman, not a scholar... But as a simple man craving for knowledge, I have read all the work of these renowned geographers and discovered that none of them could agree on the exact width of this ocean...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Therefore, as a modest man, I wonder:  who is right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who is right?  This question remains unanswered.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your Eminence, there is only one way to settle the matter.  And that is to make the journey. (to the assembly, with passion) I am ready to risk my life to prove it possible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your life, and that of others!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If they agree to follow me, yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Suppose you cross this ocean. Suppose you reach Asia.  What would Spain do there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Trade, Your Excellency.  According to Marco Polo, the Kingdom of China is one of the richest of the world. Even the meanest buildings are roofed with gold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) Is that all that interests you? Gold?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.  The Portuguese have already discovered black-skinned people.  I, too, will find other populations -- and bring them to the word of God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: smiles thinly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another small rill of laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hum of interest.  CLOSE ON SANCHEZ -- watching COLUMBUS intently, a hint of an admiring smile on his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The murmur turns to an audible gasp.  AROJAZ gets to his feet and leans forward, threateningly, the flame of a candle only inches from his face. There is absolute silence.  COLUMBUS meets the MONK'S gaze unflinchingly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Christopher -- Christo Ferens -- the Bearer of the Cross!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ironic) And Colon -- the one who populates!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If God intended our proximity to Asia, do you believe he would have waited for you to show it to the world?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did He not choose a carpenter's son to reveal Himself to the world?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So you consider yourself the chosen one?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you realize your words could be considered heretical?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calmly) Blind faith is what I consider heresy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Asia can be found to the west -- and I will prove it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The JURY is alone to deliberate.  Food and wine has been laid out on tables.  In the distance, students' cries carry over the conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: approaches.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The Treasurer of Spain honors us with his presence.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: bows slightly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The State has some reason to be interested in this man's proposition, Your Eminence...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Judgment is ours!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Naturally.  But I would really deplore the loss of such a potential opportunity for Spain for a... dispute over a point of geography.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: helps himself to some grapes, looks round at the other members of the committee, who pretend not to be listening.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) He is a mercenary!  Did he not already try to convince the King of Portugal of his absurd notions?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Indeed.  The world is full of mercenaries -- and states often make use of them, when it benefits them. (casually) My only concern is the welfare and prosperity of Spain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: understands the hint, and stops smiling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You would use your influence to assist this... intriguer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: reaches for a decanter of sherry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He offers the decanter to AROJAZ, who automatically lifts his glass.  But instead, SANCHEZ pulls back the decanter, pours himself a drink, and replaces it on the table, leaving AROJAZ staring at his own empty glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he drinks with a smile.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You know, Your Eminence, the fascinating thing about power, is that what can be given so effortlessly...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... can so easily be taken away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: reads aloud the Commission's letter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shakes his head, puts the letter down.  COLUMBUS looks appalled; devastated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He paces about the book-lined room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ... and therefore nothing could justify the participation of Your Highnesses in the venture that relies upon such feeble assumptions, and which any man of knowledge would take to be impractical... if not impossible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They didn't listen.  They didn't want to listen!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mustn't give way to despair. You must wait.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait!  I've waited seven years already!  How much longer do you want me to wait?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If God intends you to go, then you will go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (angrily) Damn God!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He seizes a beautiful book from MARCHENA'S desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hurls the book across the room.  MARCHENA is horrified.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Colon!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Damn all of you!  You all set up theories based on what?  You never leave the safety of your studies! Go out!  Find out what the world is about and then tell me something I can listen to!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: These don't mean anything!  They're full of assumptions!  Out of the heads of old men who've never been past the end of their gardens!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No...!  My books...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: seizes more books from the shelves, just sweeping them to the floor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: All of them!  Just lies!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Colon!  Don't!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: tries to stop him.  In his fury, COLUMBUS accidentally knocks the poor old MAN to the ground.  His cries bring three MONKS rushing into the room. As COLUMBUS continues to rage and scatter books everywhere, they try to stop him, struggling with this big, powerful man -- to almost comical effect.  Finally, a short, muscular MONK delivers a quick punch that sends
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Father?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sssshhhh...!  One can't speak to a man doing penance.

dialogue.raw_text: What can you do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing.  That's the point, Fernando.

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Senor Colon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: turns, to see a small, stocky MAN approaching:  a middle-class gentleman.  He nods.

direction.raw_text: He laughs.  COLUMBUS smiles, but doesn't say anything.

dialogue.raw_text: Ah, thank God!  I've been looking all over Seville for you!  Never expected to find a sailor in a monastery, eh?

direction.raw_text: is clearly a little surprised.

dialogue.raw_text: What is it?  Are you a Trappist?

direction.raw_text: shakes his head again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Vow of silence...?  Penance?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods vigorously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes off his hat, wiping his forehead with a silk cloth.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus!  Just my luck!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen.  I'll do the talking for both of us.  You just nod.  Agreed? Just as I do with the wife.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods.

direction.raw_text: gives him a glance like one throws a question in the air.

dialogue.raw_text: You wonder why I believe in you? Hey, I am a seaman.  And we don't like to be told where to go, and where not to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks at him, and bursts out laughing.  The other
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks round severely.  COLUMBUS ducks behind a map,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: following him.  PINZON lowers his voice.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't look like it, but I have friends at the Court.  The Treasurer of Aragon, for example.  He finances me.  His name's Santangel.  Ever heard of him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: shakes his head, but looks increasingly interested by what he's hearing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He can get you an audience with the Queen!  You know why...?  She owes him money.  That's how it is.  You
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: me -- the Queen -- the world and his mistress -- agreed?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So.  What do you say?

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (indicating with a nod) Immediately.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: turns and sees an elegant Lord in his fifties, examining the maps.

direction.raw_text: A huge Islamic Crescent being pulled down from the minaret of a mosque.  SOLDIERS are holding back a crowd at the foot of the tower.  To the ecstatic cries of the crowd, a Cross is hoisted up in its place... Astride horses,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and the Treasurer SANTANGEL are watching the scene. They push through an extraordinary scene.  The city of Granada has just been reclaimed from the moors after several years of siege.  All around them, SPANISH SOLDIERS are herding, bedraggled columns of the defeated MOORS, bearing only a few possessions.  Ragged, half-starved men, women and children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The THREE HORSEMEN pass a procession of grateful
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: These people built Granada... Centuries ago!  It is a great victory over the Moors, Don Colon -- and yet what a tragedy it is!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: who are crawling on their knees, chanting psalms and flagellating themselves.  At the head of the procession, HOODED PRIESTS carry a statue of the Virgin Mary swathed in silk and lace. The gates of the Alhambra Palace are in sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bells are pealing triumphantly.  The noise is tumultuous. They ride towards the magnificent palace.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Is this a good time to meet her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It couldn't be better.  Victors can't say no.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Fabulous Moorish gardens:  ponds filled with golden carp; exotic bird cages hang from lemon trees... The distant sounds of victory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and COLUMBUS walk through the gardens, escorted by HALBERDIERS.  SOLDIERS pass by, carrying coffers or piles of documents. As they approach the inner sanctum, however, there are fewer people.  They stop by the Lion's Fountain, where several DIGNITARIES are waiting patiently for an audience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: appears.  They bow.  SANTANGEL approaches to murmur a compliment.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Your Excellency... truly grateful... your help... as ever...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: protests softly, and looks over at COLUMBUS, a half-smile forming on his lips.  Then a DUENA appears, and motions for COLUMBUS to follow.

direction.raw_text: An ornate Moorish door is pushed open by the DUENA'S hand. We enter the Throne Room -- sculptured colonnades, mosaics... At the far end, windows open onto a view of Granada's rooftops. Against this dazzling light, the delicate silhouette of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  The light in her blonde hair creates a halo around her head as she turns.  COLUMBUS falls to his knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He approaches the window, stopping close to her.  ISABEL scrutinizes him quickly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Rise...!  Come forward!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I should not even be listening to you, since my council said no.  But Santangel tells me you are a man of honor and sincerity... And Sanchez, that you are not a fool.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (bold) No more than the woman who said she would take Granada from the Moors.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: smiles, enjoying the lack of obsequiousness.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The ocean is uncrossable?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did they say about Granada before today?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a beat) That she was impregnable.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: smiles again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A direct challenge.  She doesn't know what to make of this man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This little hint of vulnerability subtly reverses their positions for a moment.  Now we sense COLUMBUS scrutinizing her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A slight pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She bursts out laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once again taken off guard, ISABEL flushes, and turns away slightly to hide it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pause.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I cannot ignore the verdict of my council.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Surely you can do anything you want.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How little you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: May I speak freely?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a smile) You show no inclination to speak otherwise!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know what I see.  I see someone who doesn't accept the world as it is.  Who's not afraid.  I see a women who thinks... "What if?"...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (amused at his familiarity) A woman?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forgive me... but you're the only Queen I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then we are equal... since you are the only sailor I know!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How old are you, Senor Colon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thirty seven, Your Majesty... And you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thirty eight...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You will be informed of our decision.

direction.raw_text: And he goes out, leaving her stunned.

dialogue.raw_text: Actually, I thought you were younger than me!

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The CLERK enters an imposing stable block. In the paddock, SANCHEZ is training a magnificent young horse, making it step sideways, bending it to his will. The ADMINISTRATOR watches him, unable to interrupt. Behind him the two SERVANTS can be seen bringing in the silver trays, with covered dishes of food, a decanter of wine.  They begin to lay them out on a table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pours himself some wine, tucks into his his food, while the ADMINISTRATOR, clearly working himself up into a frenzy, reads from a document.

direction.raw_text: The ADMINISTRATOR looks up again.

dialogue.raw_text: Go on!

dialogue.raw_text: No, the pheasant.  It's almost raw.

direction.raw_text: A luminous procession passes through a Moorish stone gate, down to the harbor.  We see the faces of the SAILORS and their FAMILIES -- COLUMBUS, PINZON AMONGST THEM -- We sense the fervor and apprehension of the departure.  The procession is lead by MARCHENA and four young NOVICES carrying the Madonna.  All hold long, burning tapers, saying the rosary.  A SAILOR pushes through the crowd, and kisses the Madonna's feet.

direction.raw_text: Hundreds of candles flicker in the pre-dawn light, held by the FAMILIES and FRIENDS of the SAILORS. The SANTA MARIA the PINTA and the NINA nestle against the quayside.  Dwarfed by the hulls, a flotilla of smaller fishing craft, returning from night fishing, accidentally witness this event.

direction.raw_text: sits on a barrel and crosses himself.  Behind a curtain sits COLUMBUS.

direction.raw_text: head nods lower and lower to his chest.  He is asleep.  We become aware of a sharp buzzing sound.  It becomes louder as we move closer to COLUMBUS' face. A mosquito lands on his temple.  COLUMBUS reflexively slaps it.  He wakes up, and looks at his fingers -- a spot of blood, a crushed mosquito.  He stares at it for a moment.  Then slowly gets to his feet.

direction.raw_text: In the luminous moonlight, COLUMBUS is standing, staring up at thousands of insects that wheel around the mast lantern.  We hear the flutter of their wings and see the bats as they swoop and dive in a feeding frenzy.

direction.raw_text: turns, stares into the darkness, desperate to see the land that must be close. He kneels by MENDEZ, wrapped in a blanket.  He touches his shoulder.

direction.raw_text: grimaces, and opens one eye.

dialogue.raw_text: Land...
