direction.raw_text: An opaque dawn.  COLUMBUS, riveted, staring forward as if to pierce the mist.  The entire crew are clinging to the rail, and standing on the shrouds. Suddenly, the SHIP BOY'S voice cracking with emotion.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...!  TIERRA!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: strains his eyes; he still can not see anything. The entire CREW stand and stare, silent, holding their breath. As the sun begins to rise, the fog dissipates -- slowly, exquisitely, revealing a single palm, so close it seems almost as though they could touch it.  Then a white slash of beach. Near COLUMBUS, a SAILOR falls to his knees and burst into tears.  Others laugh with joy.  COLUMBUS watches this vision in disbelief, his mouth open as if it were difficult for him to breathe.  Tears come to his eyes.  He closes them.  Then opens them again.  The land is there -- a green paradise. On screen the words:  OCTOBER 12, 1942.  GUANAHAN ISLAND EXT.  BOATS - DAY Three row boats plunging through the surf towards the beach.  COLUMBUS stands in the prow of the first boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is in the second.  PINZON the third.  They stare entranced at the lushness of the foliage, and the blue clarity of the water... As the first boat beaches, COLUMBUS leaps out and wades ashore.  Behind him the rest of the landing party splash through the sun-dazzled water, carrying the banner of Castille and Aragon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stand on the beach, almost in a dream.  There is silence.  The ROYAL NOTARY, ludicrously overdressed, now wet through, stumbles over to COLUMBUS and holds out his contract and a pen.  COLUMBUS scrawls his name. The MEN stare at him, filled not only with new respect, but with something amounting to awe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns to them, tries to speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He swallows.  Tears have sprung to his eyes.  He is so moved he cannot continue.  Coming to his rescue -- THE SHIP'S BOY starts to roll the drum.  He then stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MEN cheer as the flags are rammed into the sand, flapping in the wind.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: By the... by the Grace of... God...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pulling himself together) In the name of their Gracious Majesties of Castille and Aragon, and by all the powers vested in me, I claim this island and name it San Salvador.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: starts to walk towards the jungle, and in silence the rest follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Immediately they are met by an incredible wall of SOUND! The jungle is filled with NOISE.  The impossibly-loud
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of EXOTIC BIRDS, the CHATTERING of MONKEYS.  The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are overwhelmed. They move forward.  Rays of sunlight pierce through the high canopy of leaves, like the roof of a magnificent cathedral.  The sounds and smells intoxicate their senses. They are filled with wonder. Then PINZON stops.  He has seen something.  Another stops, then a third, staring ahead of them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Several of them raise their weapons to their shoulders, pointing them into the jungle. From COLUMBUS' POV we slowly scan the face of the thick jungle ahead.  For a moment we don't see anything -- and then, with a shock, we see the first INDIAN.  Naked, painted like an idol, carrying a hunting lance. As if they had materialized from nowhere:  the rest of the
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering urgently) Arquebuses!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: with their bows and spears.  Silent. Watchful.  They stare back at us. The SPANIARDS nervously finger their weapons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slowly lifts his hand into the air:  a clear signal not to fire.  Then, removing his sword, he drops it on the ground, and starts to walk forward, fixing his gaze upon the first INDIAN he saw.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (warningly) Colon!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ignores him, even though some of the INDIANS have raised their weapons.  He stops in the no-man's land between them.  The INDIANS don't move -- but something excites them. The SHIP'S BOY, wearing COLUMBUS' embroidered jacket and the drum, has followed COLUMBUS and now stands close to him.  He is the cause of their interest.  COLUMBUS puts his arm around the BOY, and this gesture of affection seems to put the INDIANS at their ease.  They start talking and pointing.  They come forward slowly, start to tentatively touch the BOY'S jacket.  Then, now laughing, they touch COLUMBUS, pulling at his beard.  COLUMBUS laughs too. Sensing their innocence, the rest of the MEN lower their weapons.  Some of them laugh. An apparition:  a beautiful young INDIAN GIRL, totally naked, walks out of the jungle. She is pregnant and holds a child.  We begin to hear Indian music, played on a flute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A large post is lifted from the ground by two SPANIARDS pulling on ropes.  The post is fixed into position -- and then we see that it is a large wooden cross... The INDIAN VILLAGERS watch the ceremony with some interest and amusement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks over at the men and gestures at the
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We have come here in peace, and we will behave with honor.  They are not savages and neither will you be. Treat these people as you would your own wives and your own children. Neither are you free to take what you will; for a seashell you give a bandana.  You will respect their beliefs.  Pillage will be punished by the whip.  Rape by the sword.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The smoke from fires.  Laughter.  Music playing.  The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: have prepared food for the SPANIARDS, who are drinking and enjoying themselves in this strange world.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: INDIAN CHIEF, ELDERS OF THE VILLAGE

direction.raw_text: sits with MENDEZ, PINZON, the INDIAN CHIEF, ELDERS OF THE VILLAGE.  Other INDIANS stand around, smiling, curious. The INDIANS talk among themselves.  The ELDERS smoke primitive cigars -- and offer them, with good humor, to their guests.  The SPANIARDS cough and choke at first... and laugh.  In return, they offer the INDIANS wine... Dogs roam around the campfires.  The WOMEN openly suckle their babies.  The MEN are entranced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: draws out attention, for the first time, to a small gold ornament on the nose of one of the INDIANS.  He points to it, indicates his interest in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The INDIANS says the word in his own language, laughing. We see that some of the other INDIANS also have small gold ornaments.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Gold...!  Gold!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: repeats the INDIAN word for gold.  The INDIAN removes the ornament from his nose, gives it to PINZON, who indicates that he wants to have it.  The INDIAN nods
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: but points to PINZON'S dagger, indicating that he wants it in return.  PINZON shakes his head, stops the INDIAN from taking it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Pinzon) Give it to him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks at him, about to argue -- but COLUMBUS insists.  PINZON takes out the dagger and offers it to the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His friends laugh.  Innocently, the INDIAN has taken it by the blade.  He yelps, looks down at the blood welling up... A moment of tension... Then MENDEZ laughs at his clumsiness, and the ELDERS laugh too... and the INDIAN laughs. Just outside this circle, we see the first INDIAN we saw, squatting on his haunches, watching.  This is UTAPAN.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (irritated) By God!  That's the worst trade of my life!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The first light outside -- the strange, wonderful sounds of the jungle all around.  COLUMBUS writes in his journal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks up.  UTAPAN is squatting in the doorway of the hut.  He's been there all night.  COLUMBUS takes more ink on his quill and begins to sketch UTAPAN'S face in the margin of his log-book.  He draws well. He gets up and walks over to UTAPAN and shows him the drawing.  It's an electrifying moment.  UTAPAN is shocked and amazed.  At first he is rather frightened of his own image... Then he is happy, and laughs... and COLUMBUS laughs with him and puts a hand on his shoulder in a gesture of friendship.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) October 21st, 1492.  I think we have returned to Eden.  Surely this is how the world once was, before the beginning of time.  I believe no man will ever see this land again as we do, for the first time...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: gets up, and indicates that he too has something he wishes to offer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: expertly scampering through the jungle.  COLUMBUS follows him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: orders COLUMBUS to sit.  COLUMBUS obeys.  UTAPAN looks up at the tops of the trees.  The sun is rising, and filters through the foliage.  As if the time had come,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands up, and COLUMBUS does the same. A gap in the dense vegetation.  Something is glittering. Gold.  A mass of gold.  As they approach, COLUMBUS discovers -- A large pool of fresh water.  The morning sunlight has turned the water into liquid gold.  The surface ripples with the breeze.  UTAPAN smiles.  It the stranger satisfied?  Isn't this what he came for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: plunges into the pool.  As he emerges, he fills his palms with liquid gold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wide shot -- A flotilla of canoes are going upstream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are traveling together in the canoes.  UTAPAN leads the expedition in COLUMBUS' craft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: cranium is shaved like UTAPAN'S, and we notice that some other crew members are beardless, some even wearing tribal patterns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: confronting the SPANIARDS, UTAPAN talks to an ELDER MAN, watched by COLUMBUS, MENDEZ and PINZON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: repeats several times the word for GOLD, showing some artifacts.  The OLD INDIAN shakes his head no, indicating another distant place.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Cuba!  Cuba!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods, points into the distance, chatters away to UTAPAN.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Say not here!  Cuba!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it?  A tribe?  An island?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Island.  Far.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Standing at the prow of the ship, his long dark hair floating in the wind, UTAPAN rejoicing at the speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Led by UTAPAN, the SPANIARDS hack their way through thick jungle.  It's hard work.  The MEN sweat.  This is inhospitable terrain.  Even the noises of the jungle seem somehow more sinister...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : RESTING PLACE - ALONSO is seated under a tree.  He takes off his boot, and grabs his foot, examining the blisters on his toes.  As he puts his foot back into the boot, he jumps screaming in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: yelps, grasping his ankle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON a snake sliding out of the empty boot. While his COMPANIONS rush to him, a SAILOR spots the snake, and decapitates it with his sword.  UTAPAN glances at the dead snake.  He then goes and kneels -- he sees the bite on ALONSO'S ankle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Help him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is quiet and silent.  His eyes are looking around at his companions.  UTAPAN shakes his head.  There is nothing he can do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is now leaning back, supported by one of his friends.  He has grabbed the forearm of a SAILOR.  His look is already far away.  His companion shouts at UTAPAN.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Do something!  Help him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: starts convulsing.  HIS FRIENDS hold him, desperate in their helplessness.  Others simply move away, horrified.  One of them cries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Standing in the stream up to his thighs, A SPANIARD (a gold expert) examines some stones.  He then looks up at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and PINZON and just throws the stones back into the water without a word. The group of SPANIARDS are resting, exhausted by the humidity.  Some are drinking from the river, others soak bandanas, and tie them around their necks... One after another, they stand up slowly -- they look discouraged, tired, and beaten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and the SPANIARDS are trekking in the hills.  Fully armed, they are now suffering intensely from the heat and the vicious insect bites.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: doggedly keeps up with UTAPAN, who tirelessly trots forward. Finally, COLUMBUS turns around and sees... nobody.  He calls out to UTAPAN.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Utapan!  Wait!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: stops obediently, and rushes back to COLUMBUS with comical energy. On their way back, they find one SOLDIER sitting, leaning against a tree.  He has removed his helmet.  His hair sticking to his forehead. As COLUMBUS and UTAPAN walk back, they find another
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: then another, then the whole group gathered around
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  Ashen, he burns with fever.  He attempts a smile.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well... You'll have to continue without me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks around him -- what he sees:  exhausted men and jungle, as far as one can see.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No.  It's enough.  What would you say to a drop of Jerez, Pinzon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all laugh as the OFFICER helps PINZON to his feet.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And a nice slice of Santa Fe lamb! I'd sell my soul for it. (to his officer) Help me up.  I've got to piss, gold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: walks a few yards into the jungle -- starts to urinate.  It is red.  Suddenly dizzy, he reels and collapses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A line of SPANIARDS and INDIANS threading their way down a mountainside.  PINZON is being carried on a makeshift stretcher.  His eyes are closed, his face thick with sweat. They enter a village, to the surprise of the INDIANS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: once again at the front as the ambassador.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is forcing a milky fluid into PINZON'S mouth.  COLUMBUS attempts a gesture to prevent him.  But
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stops him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He cures.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods -- he obviously trusts UTAPAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the half-light, figures wreathed in smoke -- COLUMBUS, MENDEZ and UTAPAN watch the CHIEF GUARIONEX putting a Spanish helmet on his head.  The helmet is too big, almost covering his eyes.  The ELDERS appraise the gift with solemn wonder. In return, GUARIONEX hands COLUMBUS a parcel made of leaves.  COLUMBUS unwraps them.  Inside:  a GOLD grimacing mask.  The first real piece of gold.  COLUMBUS is unable to conceal his excitement at this first real evidence of the metal. He waits for the CHIEF to speak, but the CHIEF only looks at him.  On the ground, we see other presents offered by the SPANIARDS -- trinkets, and necklaces...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Columbus) You come!  You speak first!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell the Chief we thank him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Chief knows.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell him his country is very beautiful.  Tell him we are leaving men here -- to build a fort.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: translates.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Tell him we will return very soon. Many of us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: translates.  The CHIEF GUARIONEX asks a simple question.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Chief says -- how many?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thousands.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: doesn't seem to understand the question.  For the first time he seems to be caught short.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: To bring the word of God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Chief says -- he has a God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pursuing) ... and also to bring medicine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Chief says...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) He has medicine. (pause) Tell him we admire his people.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: translates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the CHIEF gets up, awards COLUMBUS with a smile, and walks out of the hut, the ELDERS following, leaving
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Chief says he knows you like his... (searches for the word) Women...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: alone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (with a little smile) That's a beginning...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Watched from the shore by the INDIANS and by about forty of the SPANIARDS, who are staying behind, the boats pull out towards the two remaining ships.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is laid out in the bottom of the boat.  COLUMBUS, UTAPAN, and four other INDIANS are in the same boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boats continue to pull away, the figures on the shore growing smaller.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) March 1493... Thirty nine of my men volunteered to stay behind.  God willing we will be back in less than a year...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ON:  a golden mask... the lamp in the cabin swings violently back and forth, creating strange shadows, as if the mask was alive... COLUMBUS is writing with difficulty in his log-book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly the cabin seems to lurch over.  Things fall from the table, smashing on the floor... COLUMBUS nearly falls.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) ... Several men are ill.  We did not find signs of civilization.  No cities, no temples... Nothing that resembles Marco Polo's descriptions. My ships are not filled with the spices and the gold that Spain was hoping for.  But this land intoxicates the senses like the strongest of perfumes... And all I can think of, is to return to these untamed lands...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We are in the middle of a violent storm -- of terrifying proportions.  The thunder is deafening.  Light irradiates the darkness.  We see the two caravels, dwarfed by the massive seas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five MEN are struggling to lash down the tiller.  The deck jumps and rolls.  It rises five meters into the air then falls into space and hits the water with a terrible crack. Waves sweep over the decks.  We hear desperate cries for mercy from the terrified crew, loud enough to be heard above the storm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and MENDEZ are crawling towards the mast, along a lifeline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MEN start to scramble below decks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ship rolls again.  COLUMBUS and MENDEZ crawl towards the mast.  Another gigantic wave crashes over them, tons of water falling like cement.  They reach the mast.  The wood groans.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (screaming to the sailors) Get below!  All of you!  Go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Mendez) Stay with me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We may have to cut it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods... COLUMBUS grabs some rope.  The ship rises into the air again, crashes down, the deck disappearing beneath them for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With MENDEZ'S help, COLUMBUS is tied to the mast:  one rope under his arms, the other around his waist.  MENDEZ hands him a horn.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (screaming out) I'll stay here -- to decide if we cut it.  Help me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (screaming) Now go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: seems to hesitate.  COLUMBUS screams at him again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I said -- below deck, Mendez!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: crawls away. Another huge wave washes over COLUMBUS.  He emerges, almost suffocated.  The storm rages, its eerie light making it seem at times like bright daylight.  But as the lightning flashes, COLUMBUS begins to count:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's an enormous thunderclap on "four" -- it indicates how close they are to the eye of the storm. The ship keels over again, dropping down and down, seeming never to rise... COLUMBUS lifts his head to the heavens, screams out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As if in answer, another flash of lightning that illuminates the sky and the sea.  COLUMBUS starts counting again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another terrible clap of thunder on "five" -- COLUMBUS starts laughing, knowing the storm is moving on. Then, in the strange light, something seems to move through the air towards him; it looks like some kind of projectile, a craft, with a trail of vapor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: One... two... three... four...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Damn you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One... two... three... four... five...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: stares up at it... amazed.  We start to hear the "Te Deum", majestic and heavenly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks up at the vast roof, to see an incense burner, swinging, gliding swiftly across the ceiling, trailing a think vapor of incense. A magnificent "Te Deum" is being sung -- in honor of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: achievements and return.  The whole cathedral is packed with nobles and dignitaries in their gorgeous robes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and DIEGO are staring in fascination at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: triumph -- somewhat separated by the grandeur of this occasion.  COLUMBUS passes by, walking proudly down the long central alley, beside KING FERDINAND and QUEEN ISABEL and other GRANDEES.  He turns to his family, keeping his eyes on BEATRIX until she is out of his vision. The procession is followed by UTAPAN, and other INDIANS in tribal regalia... As they move through the crowds, all eyes are upon
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a simple room, a PRIEST finishes giving the Last Rites and a sheet is pulled over the head of MARTIN PINZON.  His
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and CHILDREN weep at the bedside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A stool passes from hands to hands.  It is placed at the Queen and King's side.  COLUMBUS sits on it -- a supreme privilege. To one side sit AROJAZ and SANCHEZ.  AROJAZ leans over to whisper to him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It won't be easy to get rid of your prophet now, Don Sanchez.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering) On the contrary, Your Eminence.  It seems to me the man is preparing his own cross.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ON:  the face of a young, SPANISH NOBLEMAN, ADRIAN DE MOXICA.  Hesitantly, he brings a lighted cigar to his lips -- then pauses. We discover other people around the magnificent candle-lit table.  NOBLE MEN and NOBLE WOMEN.  SANCHEZ.  COLUMBUS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes the cigar from MOXICA.  The rest watch him with rapt curiosity.  COLUMBUS inhales deeply then, to their astonishment, blows out the smoke through his nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands the cigar back to MOXICA.  With a casual air,
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You must not inhale, but simply allow the palate to enjoy the flavor of the Tobacco...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: himself inhales deeply -- almost chokes to death. He gulps down a glass of wine... much to the amusement of the others.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (deeply embarrassed) And you say this is an Indian vice? By God!  I don't see any kind of pleasure that would make this a sin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Indians have no such word, Don Moxica.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do they have such thoughts?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They come and go as naked as the day God created them...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: blushes slightly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They don't see sin in their nakedness.  They live according to nature, in a never ending summer. The islands are covered with trees, filled with blossoms and fruits. And...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) Forgive me, Don Colon.  But what about gold?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods, turns and whispers something to a SERVANT standing just behind his chair.  The SERVANT goes to open the door -- and in comes UTAPAN, dressed as a tribesman, carrying a casket.  The WOMEN around the table fan themselves furiously at the sight.  UTAPAN puts the casket down in front of the QUEEN, and steps back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: These are gifts for Your Majesty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: opens the casket, revealing the gleam of gold inside.  She takes out some of the little golden ornaments... a bracelet and then the mask. She holds it, somehow moved by its crude beauty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: raises the mask to her face, looking across at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The image is somehow powerful enough to reduce even the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to silence.  She speaks from behind the mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guests laugh obsequiously.  COLUMBUS bows a little -- looks up and meets the eyes of SANCHEZ, who is staring at him, coldly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We are more than gratified.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: advances towards us with determination, his sword flashing.  He is fighting an adversary we do not see, and comments his movements.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We discover the SWORD MASTER is fencing with COLUMBUS.  A dozen duellists are practicing in the magnificent rotunda, surrounded with a two-tiered colonnade. Out of breath, COLUMBUS stops the exercise, and removes his protective canvas padding.  He bows at his teacher, who salutes him in return.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Si!  Si!  Muy bien!  Excellente! (Yes!  Yes!  Good!  Excellent!)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: walks to a tressel laden with food and beverages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in a fencing outfit and boots, is having a glass of wine.  Upon seeing COLUMBUS approaching, he hands him a glass.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You defend yourself admirably...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... for a commoner?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: laughs and raises his glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They drink.  A short, somewhat ugly man, with some kind of imposing energy, approach them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: To your second expedition.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don Colon -- Don Alonso de Bobadilla.  A man who knows our laws.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: bows.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I understand that you will soon be appointing Governors for the islands?  Is it not so?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forgive me, Don Bobadilla -- those positions have already been taken.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (disappointed) May I ask by whom?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bartolome and Giacomo Colon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks at him in surprise.  BOBADILLA reddens.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I trust they are men of quality.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: glances at SANCHEZ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A grin disfigures the face of BOBADILLA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he walks off.  SANCHEZ fills his mouth with a slice of ham.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: But we do have a lack of notaries. You should contact my administration.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (amused) Don Bobadilla is already a judge, my Dear Don Cristobal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good!  We are also in need of judges.  Except there are no thieves!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Sanchez) I see I was mistaken.  Don Colon has no need for my services...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (amused) You seem to have a special talent for making friends.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What...?  Do I have so many already?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (seriously) To rise so high, in so short a time, is a dangerous occupation. (kindly) A little hypocrisy goes a long way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: with two MEN:  the oldest, around thirty, is a strong-looking man.  The youngest, no more than twenty five, is thin and fit.  There is obvious tension in the room.  These are BARTOLOME and GIACOMO COLON, COLUMBUS' brothers.  BARTOLOME is angry, and GIACOMO thoughtful.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You might have given us a choice!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bartolome is stronger, more capable than I will ever be...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need both of you.  What are you afraid of?  We are living what we always dreamt of.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know I never shared those dreams with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you saying you refuse to help?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks at them with such pained surprise...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He opens the door to a terrace.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (amused) You bastard... you always had your own way...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me show you something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The large gallery courtyard is crowded with PEOPLE -- applicants for the voyage.  As COLUMBUS appears, they all press forward, calling out his name, trying to get his attention, touching his sleeves as if he were a saint. They crowd around COLUMBUS and his BROTHERS.  COLUMBUS nods, murmurs vaguely, here and there...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fighting their way through, the BOTHERS press their way, reaching the other side of the gallery.  We get glimpses of the incredible activity down below.  ADMINISTRATORS, MILITARIES, MERCHANTS are busy around tressels covered with documents, plans, maps... preparing the second expedition.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Of course... Of course... We'll see to it... Yes... Thank you... Soon... Soon...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: puts his arms around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks then to the balustrade.  The cries from the courtyard down below subside... some of the applicants begin to look up, aware of his presence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leans over the balcony.  In the middle of the overcrowded courtyard, the SOLDIER who was shouting is brandishing a document.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (indicating the applicants) Now -- you tell me.  Who can I trust? (almost amused) We're brothers!  We must be a House. A bloodline!  In this country one can't exist alone!  I need you...! Both of you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where is the Admiral?  Has anyone seen the Admiral?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He is here!  What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Admiral!  The horses have arrived.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know.  I saw them!  Who did we hire today?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: raises his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The whole courtyard bursts out laughing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Thirty blacksmiths, twenty eight halberdiers, twenty carpenters, a hundred farmers, twenty miners... and Doctor Chanca, the royal surgeon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The royal surgeon?  Then we can count on royal health!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is lying in his hammock.  FERNANDO turns him over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: falls to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks beside BEATRIX.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at his son) He's growing up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: smiles, nods.  They walk on.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Beatrix, I want to ask you something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a smile) You don't usually ask.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a pause) I can arrange for the Queen to take Fernando and Diego into her service.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: stops in her tracks, looks at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It is a great honor.  We could not hope for anything better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods, but bites her lip, and looks back at
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: For once I wish you weren't right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: puts his arm around her waist, pulling her closer, they move away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is now swinging expertly in the hammock.  UTAPAN is pushing him gently.  He slowly straightens up to watch
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and BEATRIX disappear, somehow sensing there is a dilemma.  FERNANDO noticing UTAPAN'S reaction, turns to his parents.  The arbor is empty.  FERNANDO becomes pensive. We become aware of the rustling of the jungle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: spread along the beach, looking towards the jungle.  COLUMBUS stands beside his BROTHERS, and MENDEZ, and UTAPAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: astride a magnificent black horse, prances back and forth across the sand.  All are waiting. A signal cannon is fired from one of the ships.  Birds scatter into the air from the jungle -- but then silence, complete and ominous.  COLUMBUS stares into the jungle. Nothing.  No one to greet them -- no welcoming party from the MEN they left behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: glances at MENDEZ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him, but can't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: suddenly spurs on his horse, and guides it into the trees.  The order is given for the rest to follow, fanning out as they do so, weapons at the ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ruins.  The camp has been burned to ashes.  A strange sight:  arrows are stuck vertically into the ground, each with a moldering tuft of human hair attached to the flight. In silence the SOLDIERS pick their way through the devastation. The ground is littered with coconuts.  Kicking one over with his shoe, a SOLDIER discovers that his coconut is actually a human skull.  The gaping mouth has been filled to the brim with gold. But of the living, there is no sign.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Is this your new world, Don Colon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: A YOUNG NOBLEMAN, HERNANDO DE GUEVARA,

direction.raw_text: looks around in dismay.  A YOUNG NOBLEMAN, HERNANDO DE GUEVARA, takes out his sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Other SPANIARDS join in, repeating this last word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silence.  Everyone looks at COLUMBUS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are all listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks among them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: These animals should be shown what savagery can be!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Three heads for every life taken. No mercy before God!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No mercy!  Let's find them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No Guevara.  There will be no revenge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We lost cousins, friends.  We will wash this in blood.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you want to keep your head on your shoulders, you'll do as I say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Moxica, I lost friends too... Thirty nine brave men who trusted me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You want a war?  Fine.  We are a thousand.  They outnumber us by ten! Who will you kill?  Which tribe?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We don't need to know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We came here to stay!  To build! Not to start a crusade.  In this forest, there is enough danger to sweep us away in days!  So we will be brave and swallow our grief.  And in the name of those who died, we will accomplish what we came for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: mounted on his magnificent BLACK STALLION canters to the edge of the deserted village and enters the village.  UTAPAN is terrorized by the absence of anything living. All we can hear is the breathing of the horse.  The animal, an impressive mass of muscle, prances nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: calls out in dialect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slowly, they begin to appear, one after the other -- materializing from the jungle.  Shy and scared. They stare at this "Centaur" (the HORSE and the HORSEMAN seem to be one -- a God). To impress them even more, MOXICA makes the beast move sideways and backwards, rearing, its front hoofs pawing the air.  THE INDIANS retreat in terror, except for one, who stands his ground, brandishing his lance.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: encourages the YOUNG WARRIOR to approach the centaur.  He places his hand onto the shoulder of the animal.  The muscles shudder.  THE INDIAN jumps back comically, accompanied by the rest of the tribe. Without warning, MOXICA climbs down from the saddle.  More
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: step back in fear and absolute astonishment.  Now more have ventured from the jungle.  The bravest of them approach MOXICA, daring to touch him, and the horse, retreating then touching until they fill the compound. At this moment, COLUMBUS and his SOLDIERS appear all around them, pointing their muskets, and their crossbows. A moment of tension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks forward, towards the CHIEF (GUARIONEX) we meet before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The CHIEF answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pause.  The SPANIARDS shifting, eager for blood.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ask the Chief what happened to my men?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Another tribe made war on them... came by sea... took them away...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God have mercy on their souls...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The monkey is lying.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We should kill them, Don Colon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks anxiously at COLUMBUS.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No...!  you'll do it my way. (to Utapan) Tell the Chief we will not harm his people, even though we have the power to do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: translates.  The CHIEF listens in silence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We will work with his people.  We want peace.  Ask the Chief if he understands?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He understands.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ask him if he will help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is raining hard.  COLUMBUS is floundering in the mud, supervising a mixed work-force of SPANISH and INDIANS. They are attempting to raise the huge wheel of a watermill. Despite COLUMBUS' shouts of encouragement, it's clear the wheel is far too heavy and the mud too deep. Close by, on horseback, MOXICA watches the scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: plastered with wet mud, clambers out of the pit and approaches him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don Moxica -- we need your horse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks down at the sodden, dirty figure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat.  COLUMBUS wipes some mud from his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts to turn away; COLUMBUS grabs hold of the reins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat.  MOXICA stares down at an equally determined
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We can't raise the wheel without it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My horse doesn't work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don Moxica -- we all have to work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You did not hear me, Don Colon.  Not my horse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forgive me, Don Moxica.  But it was your horse I was talking about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  Then, in front of everyone, MOXICA has to dismount, and suffer the disgrace of it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, Don Moxica.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: leads the horse away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harnessed, the horse pulls, with COLUMBUS and the MEN. The wheel is raised into position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Water thundering into the new canal.  The huge wheel begins to turn.  The MEN cheer and congratulate each other.  MOXICA looks at his mud-splattered and foaming horse, his eyes full of hatred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A wide, high shot of the new "City", dominated by a huge wooden cross -- no more than a muddy main street bordered by a hundred bamboo and stone shanties, with candles burning in the doorways.  A main square with the Governor's Mansion, and the foundations of a church. In the twilight, COLUMBUS and the other WORKERS returning, dirty and tired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and GUEVARA sit out on the "veranda", watching the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: return.  MOXICA raises his glass in an ironic salute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They laugh.  We see the smoke and flames from a fire. Four or five INDIANS are squatting on the earth nearby, cooking for them, talking quietly in their own language.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: To the Governor of the Mosquitoes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: calls out something in their language, and a naked
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes out of the house, bringing more wine.  GUEVARA stares at her lasciviously.  MOXICA, letting his hand casually brush against her flank, smiles at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns the GIRL round so that GUEVARA can admire her properly.  GUEVARA nods.  MOXICA lets the GIRL go with a peremptory order, and she disappears back inside.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Do you want her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: suddenly stands up -- unsteadily -- and sweeping his arm round in a broad gesture, says ironically:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: To the new world, my friend!  To the new world!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In an already Spanish-colonel dining room, COLUMBUS is having dinner with his brothers, BARTOLOME and GIACOMO, served by an INDIAN WOMAN -- NIMA.  GIACOMO eats with gusto.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seeing GIACOMO'S sudden blush and discomfort, as NIMA smiles at him, the other BROTHERS laugh. To cover his embarrassment, GIACOMO returns to the topic of the food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he sees BARTOLOME stifling a laugh, GIACOMO pauses.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (as Nima pours the wine) Nima's a good cook!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's more than that!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Eat!  I'll tell you later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd like to know what I'm eating.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: eats a mouthful, glances at BARTOLOME.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A look of horror crosses GIACOMO'S face; he wretches slightly, puts down his fork, and gulps down some wine. The BROTHERS laugh again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reluctantly this time, GIACOMO goes back to his dinner.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Iguana.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What wrong with it?  The Indians eat it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not an Indian.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He wishes he were back in the seminary.  Priests always eat well. (tasting his wine, grimacing) And they have very good cellars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing grows here!  Everything rots in the ground.  The wheat and vines wither before we can harvest them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've got to learn to live like the Indians. (pause) Eat your Iguana!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They are drinking and smoking cigars.  From the balcony they can see the dark mass of the jungle stretching away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is already dozing in his chair.  BARTOLOME sees it, and elbows COLUMBUS.  They both smile at their younger brother's exhaustion.  Then COLUMBUS gets up and leans on the balustrade, looking down at the city, the jungle beyond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They begin to hear the sound of a flute -- a melancholy sound.  COLUMBUS looks out over the jungle, and kills a mosquito by slapping his arm.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How much gold have we found?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not enough to justify a single shipment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perhaps it doesn't exist anywhere but in my imagination.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then let's hope not... (pause) What will happen if we can't find enough gold?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (jokingly) Then I'm Governor of the Mosquitoes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: An INDIAN is playing the flute. In the gloomy interior of the long hut, in the most primitive conditions, DOZENS OF SPANIARDS lie sick.  On a segregated part of the room are the INDIANS, several coughing. They are attended by a doctor, DOCTOR CHANCA, BROTHER BUYL, and other NOVICES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: attends to an INDIAN, gently lifting his head, helping him to drink -- there is so little they can do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks down at the body of a SPANIARD, covered in open sores.  The NOVICE joins him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of disease is this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.  It seems almost as if we have exchanged diseases with the Indians.  They die of our most common cold, and we of their plague.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God forgive us!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: covered with sores is screaming, thrashing in his agony.  He is held down, his voice muffled.  ISABEL turns away, shocked. She is in a ward full of patients, attended by a DOCTOR, SANCHEZ and other members of her court. The patients are emaciated, their faces and bodies covered with virulent sores.  NUNS move between the beds.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It seems to be caused by intimacy with the native women, Your Majesty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Will he survive?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, Your Majesty.  They go mad -- then they die.  There is nothing we can do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks around at SANCHEZ, appalled.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Every ship returns with a cargo of sick and dying.  But with no gold! The new world proves expensive, Your Majesty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We weren't expecting immediate profits, were we?  We must have faith.  We must give time for time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: bows in acknowledgement.  But ISABEL, despite her words, looks distressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excavations carved into a hillside. It is a blisteringly hot day.  At the foot of the hill,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits at a table beneath an awning, with MOXICA and several CLERKS.  ONE HUNDRED FIFTY INDIANS standing in line at the table. In turn, they hand over a small quantity of gold.  The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: weighs it on a scale, and notes down each contribution.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: impatiently gestures the INDIANS to move faster with a thonged crop.  An INDIAN approaches the table.  He is nervous.  He doesn't produce anything.  The INDIAN shakes his head, gesticulates, starts to speak rapidly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again the INDIAN pleads and gesticulates.  MOXICA hits him across the face with the thonged crop.  The INDIAN tries to run away -- but is held by a SPANISH SOLDIER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The frightened INDIAN is brought back to the table.  One of the CLERKS slips away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He says he has not found any!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's lying!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bring him here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell him to put his hands on the table.  Like this!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: At the other end of the site, the CLERK sprinting to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who was talking to a FOREMASTER.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don Giacomo, you'd better come at once!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: turns, looks back at the long line of INDIANS, still passively waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The terrified TRANSLATOR speaks to the INDIANS.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Tell them I want them to watch this!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't Moxica!  You can't...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and the CLERK running to the scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a single swift action, MOXICA draws his sword and cuts off the INDIAN'S hands.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to the clerk) I can't?  I can't?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  The INDIANS flee, disappearing into the jungle.  GIACOMO arrives at this moment.  He stares at the dismembered hands in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A tribunal.  Sitting behind a table with his brothers, and flanked by his council, COLUMBUS presides.  MOXICA stands before them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He strolls to the GUARDS at the back of the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: In one act of brutality, you have created chaos.  Tribes who were fighting each other are now joining forces against us!  All that because of your criminal savagery!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (casually) Savagery is what monkeys understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'll be held in detention, deprived of your privileges and possessions.  Until you are returned to Spain where you will be judged. Have you anything to say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with exquisite insolence) You will regret this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Everything is quiet on the mine site. On the terrace, TWO SOLDIERS are drinking in turn, and cracking jokes.  One of them leans against the wooden wall.  He laughs as he hears repeated banging behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is fucking an INDIAN WOMAN against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the terrace, his two COMPANIONS laugh and encourage his efforts. A whooshing sound.  An arrow embeds itself in the chest of the SOLDIER who was leaning against the wall.  He is nailed to the wood behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at him, transfixed, until an arrow pierces his throat.  He collapses, unable to cry out for help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in full warrior outfit, their faces painted, burst into the room.  Still busy with the WOMAN, his eyes facing the wall, the SOLDIER believes the intruders to be his friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Discovering the FOUR TERRIFYING FIGURES staring at her, the INDIAN WOMAN starts screaming and pushes back the
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (without stopping) You animals!  Can't you wait!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  He turns around, jumps off the WOMAN, and starts to scramble to the front door, trying to put on his trousers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: catch him, and force him to lay on the ground.  THE MAN struggles, his eyes rolling in terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: force his mouth open.  A THIRD ONE kneels and starts stuffing it with gold dust.  THE SOLDIER chokes and suffocates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: still stands half naked against the wall, terrified.  AN INDIAN takes his knife from his leggings, slowly.  She starts sobbing and imploring in her language.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slowly walks to her, and plants the knife in the lower part of her belly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of bloody red legs hanging still, high in the air. Pulling back, we discover:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: have been crucified on the scaffolding of the excavations.  Some hands and noses have been removed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is standing, uncomfortable among the SPANIARDS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: removes a huge iron nail from a wrist.  One of the CRUCIFIED BODIES is gently laid on the ground.  He is still alive -- not for long.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and BARTOLOME are silent with rage.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (aggressively) Moxica is right.  Our ways don't work!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: turns to UTAPAN.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (aggressively) Can you find them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks distraught -- this is the first time he is being asked to do something against his own people.  He looks up at COLUMBUS for help in confusion.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You have to find them, Utapan.  Look what they did!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You did the same to your God!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is caught short.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We have to stop this war.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods.  He walks and takes an arrow.  He examines it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Do you know them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods, uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Around a campfire, two dozen INDIANS are squatting.  They are arguing over a musket and some woolen hats they stole from the mine.  CLICK!  CLICK!  The INDIANS raise their heads.  All around them, crossbows and muskets are pointed at them.  Two INDIANS try to run away.  They are shot. This sound triggers the SPANIARDS' response.  They start shooting at random.  UTAPAN is horrified.  COLUMBUS stands up shouting.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stop!  Stop this!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and a group of rebels (GUEVARA among them), silently approach the entrance of the mansion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is stabbed and falls on his knees with a cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tears COLUMBUS' plans of the city from the wall. On the table, the model of the future city. Watched by the other ARISTOCRATS, MOXICA sets fire to the parchment he has rolled up.  He blows the flames from the torch onto the model.  Fire races up and down the streets of the miniature, as if burning the city of Isabel. A mad gleam in MOXICA'S eyes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The half-burnt remains of the Mansion.  COLUMBUS stands in the square, looking up at it.  Behind him, his SOLDIERS, his BROTHERS and about thirty captured INDIANS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks slowly across the square.  COLUMBUS looks at him in disbelief.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (through cracked lips) Moxica...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: leads his party of SOLDIERS through the jungle, looking for the MUTINEERS. They reach the river -- scan the far bank.  Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods.  His MEN start to enter the river, led by a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Others follow, wading across, their weapons held above their heads. A crossbow arrow pierces the HALBERDIER.  Without a cry he falls forward into the water, and is carried away by the current. Two more MEN are hit.  One cries out, thrashes around in the water, an arrow protruding from his side.  The river stained with blood. Still no sign of the enemy.  COLUMBUS' MEN nevertheless start to return fire from the bank, creating a shield... others continue to wade across the river.  A MUTINEER is shot down from the branches of a tree... The first MEN come ashore.  Musket fire.  An exchange of arrows.  COLUMBUS is now wading across.  The MAN next to him is killed, and carried away by the current. Now, on the far shore, the enemy have shown themselves. There is hand to hand fighting, with swords and other weapons.  MOXICA kills one of COLUMBUS' men -- but his own are outnumbered and outmatched.  Already, some are beginning to surrender. In the midst of the fighting, COLUMBUS, sword drawn, pulls himself out of the river:  A MUTINEER lunges at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: kills him with a thrust of his sword -- and walks forward into the jungle.  He spots MOXICA at the foot of a cliff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: starts scrambling up the rocks behind him, with
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: following.  The climb through the dense undergrowth is so exhausting, they are now almost climbing in slow motion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: bursts out of the undergrowth.  He is at the edge of emptiness, swept by a violent offshore wind.  He turns frantically, to see COLUMBUS coming up behind him. Knowing he is lost, MOXICA regains his natural arrogance. He steps backwards towards the edge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes another step backwards, as COLUMBUS moves towards him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smiles, and steps back into space.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You know what they will say in Spain about my death -- don't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are nothing!  You bastards will never inherit your titles.  We are everything.  We are immortal!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: His body falls, bounces off the rocks below, crashes into the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares down as his body is swept away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: expressionless face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: his face is white, he is crying and trembling.  His arms are tied behind his back.  He is held fast, a rope is put around his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sitting not far away beside his BROTHERS, gives a signal. Drums begin to beat.  BROTHER BUYL looks on impassive. A grimace suddenly transform THE YOUNG MAN'S face.  He is being garroted -- his throat crushed with a rope.  The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: feet dance frenziedly.  We hear the choking. The drums cease.  BROTHER BUYL crosses himself and murmurs a prayer, deeply distraught.  GIACOMO has covered his eyes. A wider view shows the bodies of three other ARISTOCRATS from the rebellion, attached to chairs affixed to a pole, their heads straight, the rope still tight around their necks. Justice has been done.  The members of the COUNCIL rise in silence, COLUMBUS stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON several large wooden cages.  Inside we see the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: that COLUMBUS captured.  They are packed together. They stare out with vacant eyes.  SOLDIERS guard them.  A ship against the pier.  BUYL at his side, COLUMBUS stares at the INDIANS.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I wish to go back with them, Don Colon.  I have no desire to remain in this godless place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You may do as you please, Brother Buyl -- though your departure will not help me to make it more Godly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks at him, almost with astonishment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he walks away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You treat Christians equally with heathen savages.  You execute members of the nobility.  And what do you offer in return?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) A new world, Brother Buyl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nobody wants one...!  Only you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Against the livid horizon, three black waterspouts join the sky to the sea.  A gust of wind disturbs the roof of the jungle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wind grows stronger.  Doors bang inside the building... a melancholy sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits on the balcony with his BROTHERS.  They are silent.  After a few moments, COLUMBUS begins to speak quietly, almost as if he were speaking to himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BROTHERS do not answer.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Perhaps hope only exists in the journey.  When it begins, everything is still possible -- every expectation; every dream...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is not how I imagined it to be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: begins to shave his head...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sky is dark and threatening, the wind even stronger. We find COLUMBUS where we left him, but now alone.  He has sat here all night. Shutters bang violently. He looks up -- and sees a few yards from him:  the naked
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: his face and body painted, staring at him.  COLUMBUS realizes who it is...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Utapan!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is still and silent.  A strange and mysterious figure now.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Utapan, won't you speak to me?  You used to know how to speak to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sadly, in his own language) You never learned how to speak my language.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wind is whipping the trees now, stronger and stronger. Groups of INDIANS look up at the sky.  Then, above the sound of the wind, they hear another noise.  Like a collective murmur, almost in one voice, the INDIANS repeat, over and over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a loud thunderclap, the storm suddenly breaks.  In a few seconds it has risen to violent proportions, and the landscape is drenched in torrential rain.  The wind doubles its strength... and all hell breaks loose...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Urracan... Urracan... Urracan... Urracan... (the wrath of God)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The hurricane is full force.  Trees are being ripped up by their roots.  Rivers of mud are washed down from the hills, carrying everything away in their paths:  houses, carts, equipment, horses...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mine workings flooded with mud...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and MENDEZ struggle through the teeth of the hurricane towards the dam.
direction.name: direction

After years of service to the Crown, I do not have a roof to put over my head... Your Majesty allowed me to explore the continent, believed to be Asia.  I now believe that it is an new Land, of unknown proportions and wealth... Life has more imagination than we carry in our dreams...

direction.raw_text: The DUENA, sitting beside ISABEL, quietly continues to read COLUMBUS' letter aloud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stops reading.  ISABEL turns her face away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: should be judged as a Seaman who by Divine Will discovered a New World, and thereby placed it under the sovereignty of Your Majesties. I humbly beseech Your Majesties that if it pleases God to remove me hence, you will help the name of Columbus to be remembered with honor... Weep for me, whoever has charity, truth and justice."
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: An ivory-sculptured hand -- the end of the back scratcher belonging to AROJAZ -- indicates a line across a large globe:  the route between Europe and America.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see a large amphitheater, filled with PEOPLE attending a lecture of "Nova Geographica" -- the new geography.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) The sunset route to the new continent is now well-established...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: stands in front of the assembly.  Facing him, enthroned, is KING FERDINAND, surrounded by COURTIERS, including SANCHEZ. We slowly move across the arena, passing attentive faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We continue to rise up the tiers of seats...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On a highest tier, we stop on the face of CHRISTOPHER COLUMBUS, listening impassively.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ... West by south west for 750 leagues to Santo Domingo.  From there, west north west, leaving San Juan to the north, reaching the island of Hispanola on the northern cape of San Raphael... Then onto the mainland, at the Cape called Gracias a Dios...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Spain -- by Your Majesty's grace -- has confirmed for all humanity the existence of an unknown continent... Tierra Incognita...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... This continent was first discovered by a sailor commissioned by your Majesty...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On COLUMBUS.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: His name... Amerigo Vespucci...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Around the KING, on horseback, surrounded by the KNIGHTS, a CROWD is kept back by SOLDIERS.  AROJAZ is mounting his horse.  SANCHEZ is waiting for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands among the students at the back of the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rides next to SANCHEZ.  AROJAZ suddenly spots
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in the crowd, as they move off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They pass close enough to touch COLUMBUS.  But he does not see them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My God...!  I thought he was dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can see for yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What a tragedy... what a waste of a life...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A waste...?  Let me tell you something, Arojaz.  If your name, or mine, is ever remembered -- it will only be because of his.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks at SANCHEZ in surprise -- then cranes his neck round, and looks back at COLUMBUS -- now a FACE IN THE CROWD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a very old man now, is taking a siesta next to his grapes.  He is sitting in a simple armchair, a rosary wrapped around his fingers. The presence of someone wakes him.  After a moment, he recognizes COLUMBUS and smiles.  Both MEN are very moved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They laugh.  COLUMBUS sits down.  Bees drone lazily in the sunlight.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I suppose we're both old men now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'll always be older than me, Father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have you ever forgiven me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods his head.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.  I forgave you a long time ago. You see, I was proud of you.  You were like a willful child.  You wouldn't accept what others told you.  You had to find things out for yourself, hurting yourself -- and others -- in the process.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks at his plants, sighs contentedly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Do you remember when you said that people talk about the world, but never leave their gardens.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pauses, looks across at COLUMBUS, smiles again gently.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: More than ever I wonder what it is we do achieve by leaving our gardens... The world changes -- and yet it seems the same.  We find new worlds, but fill them with the same people...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: tiring, leans back in his chair, and looks up towards the sun.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I have to disagree.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I knew you would.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: New worlds create new people.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh?  So you are a new man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know... I have the impression that I didn't change that much.  I still can't accept the world as it is!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: starts laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They both laugh.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: God bless you, and those like you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is sitting in front of his FATHER, examining documents and letters.  COLUMBUS has wrapped a shawl around his legs.  He looks even older now, with his mass of pure white hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes out with a tray, carrying grapes and a decanter of water.  She places it on a small table near
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and touches his shoulder. As she is ready to return inside the house, he holds her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smiles.  She looks at him smiling, intrigued.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Can't you stay with us a little?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am busy inside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it, now?  Tell me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't keep my eyes off you.  I would like to catch up with all the moments I didn't spend with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looks up at them above his letters, amused and slightly embarrassed.  COLUMBUS looks at him with a fake air of reproach.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are you listening to?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am not listening, Father.  But I can't help hearing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: opens a letter and reads it quickly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's Diego... He is at the Court, with Santangel... He says they hope to get your privileges restored... And maybe the house.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: smiles and nods -- all this seems to be of very little importance to him now.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: But how is he?  And Dona Maria?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: continues to read.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He opens one of them, glances at it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Fine, it seems.  Diego is thinking of starting a pearl trade, in Santo Domingo... He says he received many letters for you.  Some of your men, mostly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This one is from Mendez!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: eyes brighten with joy.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What does he say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He asks when he can come to visit you.  He left his address.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) He never had one... except aboard my ships!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: laughs -- then, suddenly serious.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I want you to tell me everything you remember, Father.  From the beginning.  Everything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really? (pause) God... I wouldn't know where to start... and yet...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me the first thing that comes to your mind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: sighs, and leans back on his chair.  His eyes are fixed somewhere, searching.  Then, almost in a murmur.

direction.raw_text: We see the page.  FERNANDO writes: ... I REMEMBER... A drop of ink falls from the quill onto the page and the words.

dialogue.raw_text: I remember...
